intro: Cyphostemma manambovensis, commonly known as the Manambobo cactus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its spiny stems and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many milkweed species. Cyphostemma manambovensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
